info.title: MileApp API - Data
info.description: MileApp API Documentation - RESTful API for field operations management.

hubIdInPath.name: hubId
hubIdInPath.description:
Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use Use [**GET /hubs**](#tag/Hub/operation/getHubs) endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

startTime.description:
Start time refers to the designated time for users to begin a task. If `startTime` is not provided, it will default to the configured time in the flow. You can view the datetime format here.
**Example:** `2022-11-02T07:28:23+00:00`

endTime.description:
End time is the deadline for completing a task. If `endTime` is not specified, it will default to the configured time in the flow.The task cannot be completed if the date has passed the `endtime`. You can view the datetime format here
**Example:** `2022-11-05T07:28:23+00:00`

assignee.description:
You can assign tasks using user email according to their task hub.  To assign tasks to multiple users, use a comma (',') as a separator.
**Example:** `['leandro@mile.app']`

background.description:
When the background parameter is set to `true` , the action will be processed in the background. In this mode, the API call will return quickly with a response indicating that the create task request has been received and is being processed asynchronously in the background. When the background parameter is set to `false` (default), the create task will be processed directly via API. This means that the API call will wait for the create task process to complete before returning the results to the user. 
 **Default:** `false`.

postExportTask.title: postExportTask
postExportTask.description: Request body schema for exporting tasks. Use filters to narrow down the dataset and customize the export output.

download.description:
File type that user want to download. There are 2 types of `download`:
**enum**: `json`,`xlsx`
**Example:** `xlsx`

fields.description:
Fields is for selecting the specific fields that you can choose by multiples to show in the response using a string with a comma delimiter.
**Example:** `startTime,endTime,hubId,createdBy,flow,status`

doneBy.description:
Name of user that completing the task.
**Example:** `Leandro`

assignee.description:
User email for a given task.
**Example**: `leandro@mile.app`

status.description:
Status of task according to task's data condition. There are 3 types of `status`:
**enum**: `UNASSIGNED`,`ONGOING`,`DONE`
**Example:** `UNASSIGNED`

flowId.description:
The identifier for the flow that generated by system. Use [GET /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow id.
Comma (,) delimiter for filter multiple flow.
**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86,73d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd87`

hubId.description:
The identifier for the hub that generated by system. Use [GET /hubs API](#tag/Hub/operation/getHubs) to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6969`

sortBy.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field. The value of this param is one of available fields on task objects.
**Example:** `flow`, `assignee`, `status`, `hubId`, etc.
**Default:** `createdTime`

sortOrder.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

background.description:
If the user sets the background parameter to `true`, the export process will utilize background processing, and the results will be available at [GET /tasks/export-log API](#tag/Export-Task/operation/GetExportLog). If the user sets the background parameter to `false`, the export process will run directly, and the results will be immediately available in the response.
**Example:** `true`.
**Default:** `false`

exportConfigId.description:
Unique identifier for the export config for allow user to export data using their own configuration. Use [GET /export-configs](#tag/Export-Config/operation/getExportConfigs) endpoint to get the list of Export Config IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

date.description:
The date indicating the time of user tracking and using the format `Y-m-d`. The default date if not filled in is today's date.

name.description:
The name of task schedule. User can define task schedule name with task's flow name combined with running time, or something else.
**Example**: `Daily Morning Visit`

periode.description:
There are 5 types of periode: **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly**, **byDate**, **custom**. Period of time when the task scheduler running.
**Example:** `daily`

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

flowId.description:
The Identifier of organization's flow. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow ids.
**Example:** `67be687c128306111e022022`

startTime.description:
Start date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of: **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly** 
**Example:** `2022-11-02`

endTime.description:
End date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of: **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly** 
**Example:** `2022-11-05`

task.description:
data of task according to selected flow.
**Example:** 
`{`
`'receiverName':'miguel',`
`'coordinates':'-6.230815251,106.75684387',`
`'address':'rawamangun jakarta timur'`
`}`

assignee.description: List of user email that will be assigned to the generated task. **Example:** `['jhon@sample.com']`

interval.description:
Number units of frequency between each scheduled execution. For example, an interval of 2 with a frequency of daily means the task will run every 2 days. This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

frequency.description:
Specified unit of time for the scheduling interval. Determines how often the scheduled task will run based on the interval value.This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

schedules.description:
Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.
**Example for periode of** `daily`:
`[{`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `weekly`:
`[{`
`'day':'sunday',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `monthly`:
`[{`
`'date':'1',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `byDate`:
`[{`
`'date':'2022-11-03',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`

day.description:

**Example:** `sunday`

time.description:

**Example:** `07:00`

date.description:
Date of task schedule will be executed. `date` is required when *periode* value is `monthly` or `byDate`.
**Example for monthly periode**: `1`
**Example for byDate periode**: `2022-11-03`

frequency.description:
Specified unit of time for the scheduling interval. Determines how often the scheduled task will run based on the interval value.This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

schedules.description:
Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.
**Example for periode of** `daily`:
`[{`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `weekly`:
`[{`
`'day':'sunday',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `monthly`:
`[{`
`'date':'1',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `byDate`:
`[{`
`'date':'2022-11-03',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`

day.description:
Name of day in a week. `day` is required when *periode* value is `weekly`.
**Example:** `sunday`

time.description:
Time of the task schedule will be executed.
**Example:** `07:00`

date.description:
Date of task schedule will be executed. `date` is required when *periode* value is `monthly` or `byDate`.
**Example for monthly periode**: `1`
**Example for byDate periode**: `2022-11-03`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

name.description:
The name of task schedule. User can define task schedule name with task's flow name combined with running time, or something else.
**Example**: `Daily Morning Visit`

periode.description:
There are 5 types of periode: `daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`, `byDate`, `custom`. Period of time when the task scheduler running.
**Example:** `daily`

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

startTime.description:
Start date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of:
`daily`, `weekly`, `monthly` 
**Example:** `2022-11-02`

endTime.description:
End date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of:
`daily`, `weekly`, `monthly` 
**Example:** `2022-11-05`

task.description:
data of task according to selected flow.
**Example:** 
`{`
`'receiverName':'miguel',`
`'coordinates':'-6.230815251,106.75684387',`
`'address':'rawamangun jakarta timur'`
`}`

hubId.description: Hub ID for the activity (optional)

tasks.description: Task configurations for each workflow step

items.description: Task data corresponding to workflow step order

_id.description: Activity ID (actually a task ID with taskType='activityMaster')

name.description: Activity name

workflow.description: Embedded workflow object for performance optimization

steps.description: Array of workflow steps with field mappings and schemas

hubId.description: Hub identifier

hub.description: Populated hub object with complete location data

tasks.description: Array of task IDs created for this activity (activityChild tasks)

subId.description: Same as tasks - array of child task IDs (for consistency with task model)

updatedTime.description: Last update timestamp in ISO 8601 format

hub.name: Jakarta Hub
hub.address: Jalan Sudirman No. 123, Jakarta Pusat, 10220, Indonesia

hubId.description:
The identifier for the hub that generated by system. Use [GET /hubs API](#Setting_Hub) to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6969`

name.description:
The name of the vehicle, which can be a number plate, vehicle brand, or any relevant identifier for the vehicle. This name is used to distinguish and label each vehicle in the route optimization results.
**Example**: `Mini Van 54`

assignee.description:
Worker's email that is assigned to the vehicle. Each vehicle can only be assigned to one worker, and this parameter helps to manage the vehicle assignments.
**Example**: `leandro@mile.app`

workingTime.description:
Working hours of the vehicle, containing **startTime**, **endTime**, and **multiday**. The time is specified in the 24-hour format, and it defines the time span during which the vehicle is available for routing tasks. In this example, the multiday value is set to 1, indicating that the vehicle's working hours span two consecutive calendar days. The vehicle starts its shift at 9:00 AM and continues until 4:00 PM the next day. 
**Example**:
`{`
`'startTime':'08:00',`
`'endTime':'17:00',`
`'multiday':0`
`}`

startTime.description:
Time of departure of the vehicle from the hub.
**Example:** `08:00`

endTime.description:
Maximum working time of vehicle to operate.
**Example:** `17:00`

multiday.description:
Additional working days accumulatedbased on the number of days.
**Example**: `0`
Implementation of **multiday** is used to add **endTime** value,
which means **endTime** = **endTime** + (24 hours * **multiday**)

breakTime.description: Indicates that the data inside represents the break time for the vehicle. containing: **startTime**, and **endTime**.

startTime.description:
The starting time of the break.
**Example:** `08:00`

endTime.description:
The ending time of the break.
**Example:** `17:00`

speed.description:
The average speed of the vehicle in kilometers per hour (km/h). Must not be less than 5 km/h.
**Example**: `30`
**Default**: `25`

fixedCost.description:
The Cost Factor value range is set from 0 to 100, with the default value being 0. A lower number signifies a higher priority for routing optimization purposes. 
**Example:** `15`
**Default:** `0`

tags.description:
Tags used for route optimization purposes. Visits with matching tags will be assigned to vehicles with the same tags.
**Example**: `['Ganjil','Depok','B1124CC']`

capacity.description:
Capacity specifications for route optimization, which are dynamic based on user needs. Includes minimum and maximum values for weight and volume.
**Example**:
`{`
`'weight':{'min':10,'max':1000},`
`'volume':{'min':10,'max':1000}`
`}`

{constraint-n}.description:
Key of capacity constraints, each with a minimum and maximum value. 
**Example**:  `{'min':10,'max':1000}`

min.description:
Minimum value of capacity constraint. Less than .max
**Example:** `10`

max.description:
Maximum value of capacity constraint. Greater than .min
**Example:** `1000`

resultId.description: Unique identifier for the routing result that generated by system. **Example:** `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

name.description:
The desired name for the routing result. Users have the flexibility to define a custom name for the result.**Default:** `Routing m-d H:i`. 
**Example:** `Routing 01-03 10:53`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

hubCoordinate.description: Coordinate of the hub. The hub coordinates represent the geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) of the central location or starting point for the route optimization process. **Example:** `-6.230815251666679,106.75684387903198`

configuration.description: Configuration settings for route optimization. The default values for these configuration settings are taken from the menu route configuration at web.mile.app.

name.description:
Name of configuration,
can be set as anything, it is used as reference in result. 
**Example**: `Configuration Default`

capacityConstraint.description:
A list of dynamic capacity types according to user needs. These constraints define the capacity limitations of the vehicles for each constraint type, such as weight, volume, etc. 
**Example**: `['weight','volume']`

multitrip.description:
When enabled, the vehicle will calculate the estimated travel time to return to the hub as the last trip.
**Default:** `false`

numberOfMultitrip.description:
Specify the maximum number of trips a vehicle is allowed to make once activate **multitrip**. In the context of this parameter, a **trip** is defined as a series of visits assigned to vehicle. When a trip is completed, the vehicle returns to the hub, ready for its next trip.
**Default:** `5` **Min:** `1` **Max:** `10`

returnToHub.description:
When enabled, the vehicle will calculate the estimated travel time to return to the hub as the last trip.
 **Default:** `false`

clustering.description:
Option : `none,normal,balanced,non-overlap` 

 Clustering optimizes your routes by efficiently grouping visits into clusters. There are four clustering types available: 

 `none`: No clustering will be applied. Use this option if you do not want to group visits. 

 `normal`: The system automatically groups visits based on proximity. This is useful if you want clustering to be handled based solely on location. 

 `balanced`: Visits are first distributed evenly among clusters to ensure a fair workload, and then grouped based on proximity. This ensures each vehicle receives a similar number of visits. 

 `non-overlap`: Use this option if you want to strictly avoid overlap between routes and assigned vehicles. The system ensures that visits and route areas do not intersect between vehicles. 

**Default:** `none`

useAllVehicle.description:
When enabled, the API will force all active vehicles to be used for route optimization. 
**Default:** `false`

autoSpeed.description:
When enabled,automatically adjusts the speed of all vehicles. If disabled, each vehicle will need to have its speed manually configured. 
**Default:** `false`

defaultSpeed.description:
Default value of the average speed of the vehicle in km/h. The speed cannot be less than 5 km/h. If not filled, the default value for speed is set to 25 km/h. 
**Example:** `15`

defaultVisitTime.description:
Idle time in minutes after arriving at each destination. This parameter represents the time needed for activities such as goods handover, waiting for customers, parking vehicles, etc., based on the business requirements. It will be used if any visit doesn't have Visit Time set explicitly. 
**Example:** `10`

crossDockingType.description:
Route visits through sub-hubs before reaching the final destination for efficient distribution. There are 2 types of crossDockingType: 
 `all`  (all visit is routed through sub-hubs before reaching the final destination) and `drop` (visits primarily go to the final destination from the main hub, with only dropped visits being routed through sub-hubs). 
**Default:** `none`

subHubs.description:
When using cross docking, it's essential to include the subHubs data. These sub-hubs are vital for determining the routing of visits before they reach their final destination. You can designate more than one sub-hub, with a maximum limit of 10 sub-hubs per request. Each sub-hub consists of four key attributes: `id`, `name`, `address`, and `coordinate`. 
Before sending the sub-hub data, there are several crucial points to remember: ensure that the hub specified as the sub-hub is valid and you have access to the hub chosen as the sub-hub, as only hubs with accessible permissions can be used.

id.description: Unique identifier for the hub that generated by system. **Example**: `642634bde1428d414838c882`

name.description: The name of hub. **Example**: `Hub transit Jakarta`

address.description: Address of the hub. **Example:** `'Neo Soho, Jakarta Barat'`

autoSplit.description:
The auto-split feature automatically splits visits with a capacity greater than the maximum capacity of the vehicle into two or more visits. This parameter specifies the strategy used for auto-splitting and can take one of three values: `none` (no auto-split), `equal` (auto-split into equal-sized visits), and `maximize` (auto-split to maximize vehicle capacity usage). 
**Default:** `none`

autoMerge.description: Default value is `false`. If set to `true`, whenever there is more than one visit with the exact latitude and longitude present, it will considered as one visit so that the solution doesn't place these visits in different vehicles. Note: Auto merge cannot be enabled when auto split is true.

multidayOption.description:
Option : `last visit,from hub`
  Configure the starting location of a vehicle for each new day in multiday routes. Choose between two modes: Start over `from hub` where the vehicle begins each new day from the designated hub regardless of its last location, or Continue from the `last visit` where the vehicle starts the new day from the location of the previous days final stop. 
**Default:** `last visit`

useOddEven.description:
Enable or disable the odd-even restriction feature. When enabled (true), the system will consider odd-even traffic rules in route optimization based on vehicle license plates and routing date. 
**Default:** `false`

oddEvenTime.description:
Defines time ranges when odd-even rules are enforced. Can contain one or more time ranges. Time format: HH:mm (24-hour format). 
**Example:** `[{'startTime': '07:00', 'endTime': '10:00'}, {'startTime': '17:00', 'endTime': '20:00'}]`

startTime.description: Start time of the odd-even restriction period. **Example:** `07:00`

endTime.description: End time of the odd-even restriction period. **Example:** `10:00`

resultCode.description: This key allows users to assign unique values for result optimization data as per their requirements. If not provided, the response will automatically generate a unique resultCode. Additionally, the `resultCode` key can be used as a filter to categorize API responses efficiently. **Default:** `Unique Timestamp` **Example:** `Route-20230801-001`

routingDate.description: Determines the routing date to comply with odd-even traffic regulations applicable on that day. This date is used to check whether vehicles are allowed to enter odd-even restricted areas based on their license plate numbers. **Format:** `Y-m-d` **Example:** `2023-08-08`

visits.description: List of visits used for routing. Each visit represents a destination to be included in the optimized route.

id.description:
Unique identifier for each visit. Visit ID's format might indicate the type of visit. Example visit IDs : 
 `taskId-6311cc36db29775ad01694e6` (Visit related to a task. You can set the visitId with this prefix on the payload of routing to tell the system that the visitId is related to a task.) 
 `hub-630ed6a4c2688c3ade723063` (Visit related to a hub. These visits are generated by the system when the routing process is finished. Normally, this kind of visit only appears on the first visit of the vehicle's trip, but if **configuration.returnToHub = true**, this type of visit will appear on the last visit of the vehicle's trip.) 
 `reload-hub-630ed6a4c2688c3ade723063` (Reload visit related to a hub. When **configuration.multitrip = true**, a visit might appear more often than usual because it allows a vehicle to go back to the hub to reload. This kind of visit has a visit ID with the prefix of **reload-hub-**)

name.description:
The name of the visit, which can be a destination name, customer name, or any relevant identifier for the visit. 
**Example:** `'Visit 1'`

address.description: Location of the visit, specified as an address. **Example:** `'Neo Soho, Jakarta Barat'`

coordinate.description:
The geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) of the visit, used in engine calculations to find the distance and travel time between visits. The format should be `latitude,longitude`. 
**Example:** `'-6.230815251666679,106.75684387903198'`

capacity.description:
Capacity is used for route optimization purposes, is dynamic based on user needs. Each constraints have maximum value equal to `9999999999`
**Example:** `{'width': 100, 'volume': 150}`

timeWindow.description:
Opening and closing hours as a time span for the destination to be visited. The time window represents the allowable time for arrival at the visit, and it uses the 24-hour format. If not specified, the visit can be visited at any time. **Note:** This field is not considered when `timeWindows` is provided. 
**Example:** `{'startTime': '08:00', 'endTime': '17:00'}`

startTime.description: Opening time of the visit. **Example:** `08:00:00`

endTime.description: Closing time of the visit. **Example:** `17:00:00`

timeWindows.description:
Array of time windows for the destination to be visited. Each time window represents an allowable time period for arrival at the visit, using the 24-hour format. When this field is provided, the `timeWindow` field will be ignored. If not specified, the visit can be visited at any time. 
**Example:** `[{'startTime': '08:00', 'endTime': '12:00'}, {'startTime': '14:00', 'endTime': '17:00'}]`

startTime.description: Opening time of the time window. **Example:** `08:00:00`

endTime.description: Closing time of the time window. **Example:** `17:00:00`

visitTime.description:
Idle time in minutes after arriving at the destination. This parameter represents the time needed for activities such as goods handover, waiting for customers, parking vehicles, etc., based on business requirements. 
**Example:** `10`

tags.description:
Tags of the visit. Visits that have tags will be assigned to vehicles with the same tags. This allows you to group visits based on specific characteristics or requirements. 
**Example:** `['Even', 'East']`

vehicles.description: List of vehicles used for routing. Each vehicle represents a specific vehicle available for the route optimization process.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the vehicle generated by the system. This identifier is used to distinguish and track individual vehicles during the optimization process. 
**Example**: `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

name.description:
The name of the vehicle, which can be a number plate, vehicle brand, or any relevant identifier for the vehicle. This name is used to distinguish and label each vehicle in the route optimization results.
**Example**: `B001ACB`

speed.description:
Default value of the average speed of the vehicle in km/h. The speed parameter represents the expected average speed at which the vehicle will travel during the route. It cannot be less than 5 km/h. If not specified, the default value for speed is set to 25 km/h.  
**Example:** `15`

fixedCost.description:
The Cost Factor value range is set from 0 to 100, with the default value being 0. A lower number signifies a higher priority for routing optimization purposes. 
**Example:** `0`

oddEven.description:
Indicates whether the vehicle license plate is classified as odd or even based on the last digit. This is used to determine if the vehicle can enter odd-even restricted areas on specific dates. **Options:** `even` (last digit is 0,2,4,6,8) or `odd` (last digit is 1,3,5,7,9). 
**Example:** `even`

assignee.description:
Worker's email that is assigned to the vehicle. Each vehicle can only be assigned to one worker, and this parameter helps to manage the vehicle assignments. 
**Example**: `miguel@mile.app`

capacity.description:
Capacity constraints for the vehicle, used for route optimization purposes. The constraints have minimum and maximum values to limit the shelter that can be accommodated by the vehicle for different capacity types, such as weight, volume, etc.
**Example**:
`{`
`'weight':{'min':10,'max':1000},`
`'volume':{'min':10,'max':1000}`
`}`

tags.description:
The tags parameter is used for route optimization purposes. Visits that have tags will be assigned to vehicles that have the same tags. This allows you to group vehicles based on specific characteristics or requirements, such as vehicle type, region, or other custom attributes. 
**Example**: `['Even','East']`

workingTime.description:
Working hours of the vehicle, containing startTime and endTime. The time is specified in the 24-hour format, and it defines the time span during which the vehicle is available for routing tasks. 
**Example**:
`{`
`'startTime':'08:00',`
`'endTime':'17:00'`
`}`

startTime.description: Time of departure of the vehicle from the hub the 24-hour format. **Example:** `08:00`

endTime.description: The maximum time limit for the vehicle to operate the 24-hour format. In the context of multi-day working schedules, users can sum the hours from different days. For example, if the vehicle works from 08:00  to 17:00  for two consecutive days, the end time can be represented as 41:00  (on the first day it end at 17 then + 24 hours for add 1 day after). **Example:** `17:00`

background.description:
When the background parameter is set to `true` , the routing will be processed in the background. In this mode, the API call will return quickly with a response indicating that the routing request has been received and is being processed asynchronously in the background. When the background parameter is set to `false` (default), the routing will be processed directly via the API, and the response will be provided immediately. This means that the API call will wait for the route optimization process to complete before returning the results to the user. 
 **Default:** `false`

currentCoordinate.description: The current latitude and longitude to calculate the order from.

visits.description: List of visits to be reordered.

id.description:
Unique identifier for each visit. Visit ID's format might indicate the type of visit. Example visit IDs : 
 `taskId-6311cc36db29775ad01694e6` (Visit related to a task. You can set the visitId with this prefix on the payload of routing to tell the system that the visitId is related to a task.)

name.description:
The name of the visit, which can be a destination name, customer name, or any relevant identifier for the visit. 
**Example:** `'Visit 1'`

address.description: Location of the visit, specified as an address. **Example:** `'Neo Soho, Jakarta Barat'`

coordinate.description:
The geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) of the visit, used in engine calculations to find the distance and travel time between visits. The format should be `latitude,longitude`. 
**Example:** `'-6.230815251666679,106.75684387903198'`

timeWindow.description:
Opening and closing hours as a time span for the destination to be visited. The time window represents the allowable time for arrival at the visit, and it uses the 24-hour format. If not specified, the visit can be visited at any time.  
**Example:** `{'startTime': '08:00', 'endTime': '17:00'}`

startTime.description: Opening time of the visit. **Example:** `08:00:00`

endTime.description: Closing time of the visit. **Example:** `17:00:00`

visitTime.description:
Idle time in minutes after arriving at the destination. This parameter represents the time needed for activities such as goods handover, waiting for customers, parking vehicles, etc., based on business requirements. 
**Example:** `10`

message.description: Message of response.

data.description: Visit  moved to vehicle KH 3267 GI by User
Visit  moved to vehicle L 1637 KIE by User

name.description:
The name used in the flow display must be unique to avoid any conflicts or confusion. Cannot use the flow name ``Activity`` as it is already in use by the system.
**Example:** `Visit`

The name used in the flow display must be unique to avoid any conflicts or confusion. Cannot use the flow name ``Activity`` as it is already in use by the system.
**Example:** `Delivery`

pages.description:
Settings that will define the detail information of flow structure. 
 **Example:** 
 `{` 
 `'id': 'page0',` 
 `'components': [`  
`{` 
`'component': 'input',` 
`'id': 'title',` 
`'type': 'string',` 
`'default': null,` 
`'title': 'Title',` 
`'required': 'true',`
`'visible': 'true',`
`'showAs': 'title'` 
`}` 
`]` 
`}`

id.description:
ID of page. 
 **Example:** `page0`

components.description:
Detail of Component. 
 **Example:** 

                `{` 

                `'component': 'input',` 

                `'id': 'title',` 

                `'type': 'string',` 

                `'default': null,` 

                `'title': 'Title',` 

                `'required': true,` 

                `'visible': true,` 

                `'showAs': 'title'` 

                `}`

id.description:
ID of component. The value that cannot be input is the reserved key. The following is a list of reserved keys : 
 `_id`,`flow`,`flowId`,`organizationId`, `hub`,`hubId`,`isDeleted`,`title`, `content`,`label`,`orderIndex`,`status`, `startTime`,`endTime`,`updatedTime`,`assignee`,  `assignedTo`,`assignedBy`,`assignedTime`,`createdBy`,  `createdFrom`,`createdTime`,`doneBy`,`doneCoordinate`,  `doneTime`,`openTaskTime`,`waitingTime`,`travelDuration `, `duration`,`distance`,`eta`,`etd`,  `assignedVehicleId`,`assignedVehicle`,`routePlannedOrder`, `expectedCoordinate`,`refId`,`createdCoordinate`,`organization`,`taskType`,`parentId`,`subId`,`workflow` 
 **Example:** `receiverName`

component.description:
Type of Component.  There are 10 types of *component*:`select`,`input`,`photo`,`signature`,`view`,`bill`,`list`,`timer`,`voice`,`capture` 
**Example:** `input`

inputType.description: The input type of the component (e.g., string, number, date, etc.)

value.description:
Component values will be displayed in other components.Field only exist, if *component* is **view** or **bill** or **list** 
**Example:** `$name`

routeAs.description:
Flag Trigger of routing data.There are 8 types of `routeAs`:
`VisitName`,`Address`,`OpenTime`,`CloseTime`,`VisitDuration`,`Coordinate`,`Tag`,`Constraint.weight` 
**Example:** `VisitName`

showAs.description:
Flag Trigger of Component title. There are 3 types of `showAs`:
`title`,`content`,`label` 
**Example:** `label`

isRequired.description:
Flag that mark field as required or not on flow component. 
**Example:** `true`

visible.description:
Flag on flow component that will make task field visible or not. 
**Example:** `true`

useUnit.description:
To set input type number using unit. Field only exist, if *component* is **number** 
**Example:** `true`

units.description:
Value of units for input type number component. Field only exist, if *component* is **number** 
**Example:** `['KG', 'G', 'M3', 'cbM']`

useGeoLock.description:
Flag Trigger of geolock feature on mobile devices. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate** 
**Example:** `true`

radius.description:
Distance in units (m) to use geolock. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate**
**Example:** `2000`

geoLockTrigger.description:
Trigger to determine when the geolock will be used. There are 2 types of `geoLockTrigger`:
`onTaskDone`,`onTaskStart`. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate** 
**Example:** `onTaskDone`

useGeocode.description:
To set coordinate use geocode. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate** 
**Example:** `true`

geocodeAs.description:
To reference geocode use the address component id. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate** 
**Example:** `address`

onSelect.description: Detailed object data of the selected event. Field only exist, if *component* is **select**

options.description:
Option on select component that when it is selected will trigger an action. 
**Example:** `['success']`

action.description:
Desired action if that option is selected. There are 3 types of `action`:
`show`,`hide`,`fill`
**Example:** `show`

componentAffected.description:
Components that will be affected by the selected action. There are 7 types of `componentAffected`:
 `text`, `date`, `dateTime`, `time`, `number`, `address`, `coordinate`. 
**Example:** `['text']`

min.description:
Min value of component. Field only exist, if *component* is **select** or **photo** 
**Example:** `0`

max.description:
Max value of component. Field only exist, if *component* is **select** or **photo** 
**Example:** `3`

categories.description:
Value of category for photo component. Field only exist, if *component* is **photo** 
**Example:** `['Living Room','Kitchen']`

watermark.description:
Configuration for users to enable watermark on photos when creating tasks. The default value of the watermark is `false`. Field only exist, if *component* is **photo** 
**Example:** `true`

addNew.description:
Configuration to allow users to add new items to the task bill or task list. Field only exist, if *component* is **bill** or **list** 
**Example:** `true`

addNewType.description:
Way to add a new list. There are 2 types of `addNewType`:
`input`,`select`. Field only exist, if *component* is **list**.  
**Example:** `select`

addNewData.description:
Detailed list of item names. Field only exist, if *component* is **list** and *addNewType* is **select** 
**Example:** `['Snack','Drink']`

addNewValidationType.description:
Configuration to set the data type validation used. There are 5 types of `addNewValidationType`:
`noValidation`,`text`,`number`,`textAndNumber`,`custom`. Field only exist, if *component* is **list** and *addNewType* is **input**. 
**Example:** `text`

addNewValidation.description:
Regex validation details following `addNewValidationType`. Field only exist, if *component* is **list** and *addNewType* is **input**. 
 **Example:** `^[a-zA-Z\s]+$`

costs.description:

useDataSource.description:

autoStart.description:

reset.description:
Configuration to enable the reset function of the timer on mobile device. Field only exist, if *component* is **timer** 
**Example:** `false`

unpausable.description:

id.description: Unique identifier for the data that generated by system. **Example:** `['EyyyuZABO6Fu1BKE6hZB']`

name.description:
Automation's name.
**Example:** `Auto create task automation`

event.description:
Act as a trigger that start an automation. There are 8 different types. 
 *enum: onTaskCreated, onTaskFinished, onTaskAssigned, onDataSourceCreated, onRoutingResultFinished, onRoutingResultDispatched, onStartTrip, onFinishTrip* 
 **onTaskCreated**: Automation will happen when a task is created. 
 **onTaskFinished**: Automation will happen when a task is finished (status task: Done). 
 **onTaskAssigned**: Automation will happen when a task is assigned to field user(s). 
 **onDataSourceCreated**: Automation will happen when a data source is created. 
 **onRoutingResultFinished**: Automation will happen when a routing created is created. 
 **onRoutingResultDispatched**: Automation will happen when a routing is dispatched. 
 **onStartTrip**: Automation will happen when a start trip is triggered. 
 **onFinishTrip**: Automation will happen when a finish trip is triggered. 
**Example:** `onTaskFinished`

dataType.description:
Automation's data type. There are 4 different types. 
 *enum: task, data, routingResult, locationHistory* 
 **Default:** `task`

isActive.description:
Automation's active state, only active automation will proceed by system
**Default:** `true`

automationType.description:
Automation's type. The changes you want to automate. There are 6 different types: 
  *enum: createTask, createAssignTask, moveTask, assignTask, webhook, createOrUpdateDataSource, notification* 
 **createTask**: The task will create when an event happens. 
**Example**: `createTask`

automationDetails.description: Set of fields according to the selected automation type. Each automationType have different automationDetails.

flow.description:
Type of task that will be created when an event happens. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createTask** and **createAssignTask** 
 **Example:** `Delivery`

flowId.description:
The Identifier of organization's flow. It required with flow param. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow ids.
**Example:** `67be687c128306111e022022`

taskData.description:
The task will be created with the given data (different flow may have different sets of field). Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createTask** and **createAssignTask** 
**Example:** 
`{`
`'customerName'`:`'vasco'`,
`'address'`:`'Jakarta'`,
`'description'`:`'$refFlow.name'`
`}`
The value can be set as static value such as: `'Jakarta'`.
or set as dynamic value according to `rules.flow` such as : `'$refFlow.name'`

hubId.description:
Unique ID to identify a hub. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **moveTask**,**createAssignTask** and **createTask** if using *event* is **onDataSourceCreated** with data type is common hub. To use a dynamic hub, you can utilize the hubId with the value `$refFlow.hubId` in the **createAssignTask** type. 
 **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

assignee.description:
List of username that has been assigned the task. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **assignTask** and **createAssignTask** 
 **Example:** `['roberto@mile.app']`

reassignment.description:
Type of reassigment that will be auto assign when user created task. Field only exist, if *event* is **onTaskFinished** or **onTaskCreated** and *automationType* is **createAssignTask**. 
 There are 3 types of *reassigment* if *event* is **onTaskFinished** :`assignee`,`assignedBy`,`doneBy`. 
 and there are 2 type of *reassigment* if *event* is **onTaskCreated** :`assignee`,`assignedBy`.  
 **Example:** `assignee`

url.description:
Reference link for using webhooks. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **webhook** 
 **Example:** `https://apiweb.mile.app/webhook`

headers.description:
The key and value will be sent using a webhook. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **webhook** 
 **Example:** `{` 
 `'x-api-key': '1234e98498ce07d29474a7ev2',` 
 `'org': 'general'` 
`}`

dataTypeId.description:
The identifier of data type. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource** 
 **Example:** `644fcd63562387038543fce2`

dataId.description:
The identifier of data source. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource** 
 **Example:** Value can be set as dynamic values according to the data source that has been mapped with the flow such as : `$refFlow.pickupNumber`

dataSource.description:
The data source will be created or updated with the given data (different data type id may have different sets of field). Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource**
**Example:** 
`{`
`'customerName'`:`'vasco'`,
`'address'`:`'Jakarta'`,
`'contact'`:`'$refFlow.phoneNumber'`
`}`
The value can be set as static value such as: `'Jakarta'`.
or set as dynamic value according to `rules.flow` such as : `'$refFlow.phoneNumber'`

updateLimitUser.description:
Configuration to run automation using user limit. If `updateLimitUser` has a value of true, users can execute automation using either 'limitUser' or 'limitType'. And if `updateLimitUser` has a value of false, the automation will run without using a user limit.Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource**..
**Example:** `false`

replaceLimitUser.description:
Configuration to replace the current existing user limit. If `replaceLimitUser` is set to `true`, users can execute automation using either `limitUser` or `limitType`, replacing the existing user limit. If `replaceLimitUser` is set to `false`, the automation will run without modifying the existing user limit. This field only exists if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource**.
 Note: `updateLimitUser` and `replaceLimitUser` cannot both be set to `true` at the same time.
**Example:** `false`

limitUser.description:
Data source automation will be created using user restrictions based on user emails in the same organization or can be empty if the data source can be accessed by all users. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource** and *updateLimitUser* or *replaceLimitUser* is **true**.
**Example:** `['john@gmail.com']`

limitType.description:
Data source automation will be created using user restrictions determined based **assignee**, **assignedBy** and **doneBy** when completing a task. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource** and *updateLimitUser* or *replaceLimitUser* is **true**.
**Example:** `assignee`

channel.description:
Field only exist, if *automationType* is **notification**
The notification provider using fonnte as third party service.
 The value must be : whatsapp.
**Example:** `whatsapp`

taskFieldReceiver.description:
Field only exist, if *automationType* is **notification** and chanel selected is whatsapp
Reference of task component for get the receiver phone. This Field must be from initial page and component type must be Phone Number.
 **Example:** `customerPhone`

secretKey.description:
Field only exist, if *automationType* is **notification** and chanel selected is whatsapp
The api key that provided by fonnte after registered an account and link a device as sender phone number.
**Example:** `wWbN#T!_UTATzFRXrd@X`

message.description:
Field only exist, if *automationType* is **notification** and chanel selected is whatsapp
Dynamic text that supports the inclusion of variables, It can contain static text and specified variable using `{` and `}` that will be replaced with actual values when the message is sent.
 Supported Variable : organization_name, link 
 *organization_name: Account Organization Name*. 
 *link: Task tracking link*.
**Example:** `Greeting, we are from {organization_name} and will be delivering to your location. Track your delivery here {link}. Thank you`

rules.description: Act as an automation's criteria. Criteria that must be true to run an Automation.

flow.description:
Filter automation by flow. When a task is created/assigned/finished with a specific flow, then the automation will take place.
**Example:** `Pickup`

flowId.description:
The Identifier of organization's flow. It required with flow param. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow ids.
**Example:** `67be687c128306111e022022`

fields.description:
Additional automation's filter. When a task is created/assigned/finished with a specific data, then the automation will take place.
**Example:** 
`{`
`'name'`:`'roger'`,
`'address'`:`'kemayoran'`
`}`

automationDetails.description: Set of fields according to the selected automation type. Each automationType have different automationDetails.

flow.description:
Type of task that will be created when an event happens.

event.description:
Act as a trigger that start an automation. There are 8 different types. 
 *enum: onTaskCreated, onTaskFinished, onTaskAssigned, onDataSourceCreated, onRoutingResultFinished, onRoutingResultDispatched, onStartTrip, onFinishTrip* 
 **onTaskCreated**: Automation will happen when a task is created. 
 **onTaskFinished**: Automation will happen when a task is finished (status task: Done). 
 **onTaskAssigned**: Automation will happen when a task is assigned to field user(s). 
 **onDataSourceCreated**: Automation will happen when a data source is created. 
 **onRoutingResultFinished**: Automation will happen when a routing created is created. 
 **onRoutingResultDispatched**: Automation will happen when a routing is dispatched. 
 **onStartTrip**: Automation will happen when a start trip is triggered. 
 **onFinishTrip**: Automation will happen when a finish trip is triggered. 
**Example:** `onTaskFinished`

**Example**: `Bearer sk_live_1234567890`

ImportMonitoringObject.description: Complete import monitoring record with all fields from the ImportMonitoring model

_id.description:
Unique identifier for the import monitoring record generated by system.
**Example:** `65f8a4c2d9e3b1234567890a`

organizationId.description:
Organization ID that owns this import.
**Example:** `63c61d865347e356d05e3052`

inputType.description: The input type of the component (e.g., string, number, date, etc.)

hubId.description:
Hub ID associated with this import (if applicable).
**Example:** `63c63ab1b6972d3150348172`

filename.description:
Original filename of the uploaded file.
**Example:** `outlets_import.xlsx`

totalRows.description:
Total number of rows in the imported file (excluding header).
**Example:** `150`

totalValid.description:
Total number of valid rows successfully imported.
**Example:** `145`

totalInvalid.description:
Total number of invalid rows that failed validation or import.
**Example:** `5`

status.description:
Current status of the import process.
- `onprocess`: Import is currently being processed
- `success`: All rows imported successfully
- `partially`: Some rows succeeded, some failed
- `failed`: Import completely failed
**enum:** `onprocess`, `success`, `partially`, `failed`
**Example:** `partially`

fileTemplate.description:
URL to download the template file for this import type. Template is generated based on data type schema or flow configuration.
**Example:** `https://staticdev.mile.app/dev-mile/templates/template_OutletDetail.xlsx`

fileFailedImported.description:
URL to download file containing failed records. Only available when status is 'partially' or 'failed' and there are invalid rows. File includes error messages for each failed row.
**Example:** `https://staticdev.mile.app/dev-mile/failed/failed_outlets_import_65f8a4c2d9e3b1234567890a.xlsx`

dataTypeId.description:
**[Datasource Import Only]** Data type ID for datasource imports. This field is populated only when type='datasource'.
Use [GET /data-types API](#tag/Data-Type/operation/getDataType) to get valid data type IDs.
**Example:** `63db2fb476bc679c540369c4`

dataTypeName.description:
**[Datasource Import Only]** Data type name for datasource imports. This field is populated only when type='datasource'.
**Example:** `OutletDetail`

flowId.description:
**[Task Import Only]** Flow ID for task imports. This field is populated only when type='task'. Note: Full task import implementation may still be in progress.
Use [GET /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get valid flow IDs.
**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86`

flowName.description:
**[Task Import Only]** Flow name for task imports. This field is populated only when type='task'. Note: Full task import implementation may still be in progress.
**Example:** `Delivery`

visitTypeId.description:
**[Visit Import Only - Future]** Visit type ID for visit imports. This field will be populated when type='visit'. Feature may be under development.
**Example:** `64a5c8d2e9f1b2345678901c`

visitTypeName.description:
**[Visit Import Only - Future]** Visit type name for visit imports. This field will be populated when type='visit'. Feature may be under development.
**Example:** `Customer Visit`

routeConfigId.description:
**[Route Import Only - Future]** Route configuration ID for route imports. This field will be populated when type='route'. Feature may be under development.
**Example:** `65b6d9e3f0a2c3456789012d`

routeConfigName.description:
**[Route Import Only - Future]** Route configuration name for route imports. This field will be populated when type='route'. Feature may be under development.
**Example:** `Daily Route Config`

errorMessage.description:
Error message if the import completely failed. Populated when status='failed'.
**Example:** `File validation failed: Invalid data type ID`

processedAt.description:
Timestamp when the import processing was completed. Format: Y-m-d H:i:s
**Example:** `2024-03-18 10:32:15`

processingDuration.description:
Duration of import processing in seconds. Calculated as difference between processedAt and createdTime.
**Example:** `90`

totalChunks.description:
Total number of chunks the file was divided into for processing. Large files are processed in chunks for better performance.
**Example:** `3`

processedChunks.description:
Number of chunks that have been processed. Use this with totalChunks to calculate processing progress.
**Example:** `3`

createdBy.description:
Email of the user who initiated the import.
**Example:** `john.doe@mile.app`

updatedBy.description:
Email of the user/system that last updated this record. Usually 'system' for background processing updates.
**Example:** `system`

createdTime.description:
Timestamp when the import was created. Format: Y-m-d H:i:s
**Example:** `2024-03-18 10:30:45`

updatedTime.description:
Timestamp when the record was last updated. Format: Y-m-d H:i:s
**Example:** `2024-03-18 10:32:15`

result.description: The routing result which includes information about countryCode, resultCode, routing details, and dropped results.

routing.description: A list of vehicles that have successfully undergone route optimization.

vehicleId.description:
The unique identifier for the vehicle generated by the system. 
**Example**: `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

vehicleName.description:
The name of the vehicle used for reference, such as a number plate or vehicle brand. 
**Example**: `B001ACB`

vehicleTags.description:
Tags assigned to the vehicle for route optimization purposes. Visits with matching tags will be assigned to vehicles with the same tags. 
**Example**: `['West','Odd']`

assignee.description:
The email address of the worker assigned to the vehicle. Each vehicle can only be assigned to one worker. 
**Example**: `roberto@mile.app`

speed.description:
The default average speed of the vehicle. The speed cannot be less than 5 km/h. If not provided, the default value is 25 km/h. 
**Example:** `15`

workingTime.description:
The working hours of the vehicle, including the start time, end time, and whether it spans multiple days. If not provided, the system will use the configuration values for routing purposes. 
**Example**:
`{`
`startTime':'08:00',`
`endTime':'17:00`
`}`

total{Constraint}.description: The sum of constraints for visits routed on this vehicle. **Example:** `100`

vehicleMax{Constraint}.description: The maximum constraint capacity of this vehicle. **Example:** `200`

vehicleMin{Constraint}.description: The minimum constraint capacity of this vehicle. **Example:** `50`

{Constraint}Percentage.description:
The percentage of constraint capacity used by this vehicle. Calculated as **totalConstraint/vehicleMaxConstraint**. 
**Example:** `50%`

totalTravelTime.description: The sum of travel times for visits routed on this vehicle, in minutes. **Example:** `100`

totalDistance.description: The sum of distances traveled for each visit on this vehicle, in meters. **Example:** `500`

trips.description: The list of routed visits for each vehicle.

visitId.description:
The unique identifier for the visit. 
**Example:** `6311cc36db29775ad01694e6`

coordinate.description:
coordinates of the visit, used for engine calculations to find distance and travel time between visits. 
**Example:** `-6.230815251666679,106.75684387903198`

visitName.description:
The name of the visit, which can be given a descriptive name based on the destination, customer, or other relevant information.  
**Example:** `Visit 1`

visitAddress.description:
The location of the visit.  
**Example:** `Neo Soho, Jakarta Barat`

tags.description:
Tags associated with the visit. Visits with matching tags will be assigned to vehicles with the same tags.
**Example:** `['West', 'Odd']`

timeWindow.description:
The time span during which the visit can be made, specified as opening and closing hours. If not provided, the visit can be made at any time. 
If this is not filled then the destination can be visited anytime.  
**Example:** `{'startTime': value, 'endTime': value}`

travelTime.description:
The estimated travel time from the previous trip to the current trip, in minutes. 
**Example:** `10`

waitingTime.description:
The idle time after arriving at the destination. This accounts for activities such as handing over goods, waiting for customers, and parking vehicles. 
**Example:** `10`

eta.description:
The estimated time of arrival at the current trip. 
**Example:** `09:34:00`

etd.description:
The estimated time of departure at the current trip. 
**Example:** `09:34:00`

distance.description:
The distance from the previous trip to the current trip, in meters. 
**Example:** `22666`

order.description:
The order of the visit handled by each vehicle's trips. Visits with smaller order values will be served first. 
**Example:** `1`

tripOrder.description:
This field exists only when multitrip is activated and the vehicle handles multiple trips. It distinguishes the list of visits on vehicle trips based on the vehicle's starting point or vehicle's reload from the hub. 
**Example:** `1`

dropped.description: Collection of trips/visits that can't optimized for some reason (failed to be routed)

id.description:
The unique identifier for the visit that was dropped. 
**Example:** `6311cc36db29775ad01694e6`

address.description:
The location of the dropped visit. 
**Example:** `Neo Soho, Jakarta Barat`

capacity.description:
The capacity constraints for the dropped visit, used for route optimization purposes. Each constraint has a maximum value of 9999999999. 
**Example:** `{'width': 100, 'height': 150}`

coordinate.description:
The coordinates of the dropped visit, used for engine calculations to find distance and travel time between visits. 
**Example:** `-6.230815251666679,106.75684387903198`

visitTime.description:
The idle time after arriving at the destination. This accounts for activities such as handing over goods, waiting for customers, and parking vehicles, based on the specific business needs. 
**Example:** `10`

tags.description:
Tags associated with the dropped visit. Visits with matching tags would have been assigned to vehicles with the same tags. 
**Example:** `['West', 'Odd']`

reason.description:
The reason why the visit was dropped. 
**Example:** `Dropped due to constraint`

name.description: The desired name for the routing result. Users have the flexibility to define a custom name for the result. **Default**: `Result Today`

post.description:
When creating a new datasource, the payload includes dynamic keys whose structure is determined by the data type specified by dataTypeId. To understand which fields are required and their respective types, you must first retrieve the schema of the data type from the endpoint [ GET /data-type/{dataTypeId}](#tag/Data-Type/operation/getDataTypeById). The response from this endpoint defines the additional dynamic keys needed in the payload beyond the standard fields such as dataId, dataTypeId, and hubId.

        
For example, if the dataTypeId refers to an outlet or store, the /data-type/{dataTypeId} endpoint might return a schema that specifies keys like outletName, outletHours, outletType, etc. These fields and their types (string, integer, boolean, etc.) must be included in the request payload when creating the datasource.
